title: Coach Interview
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, in-person, interview. Discussed the basic requirements for the role, approach to coaching, and my philosophy on athlete development. All-in-all it felt like a friendly, welcoming, environment. Felt more authentic than other interviews I've sat through
Interview Questions: What is your approach to athlete development

title: Director of Community Standards Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (Elmhurst, IL) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial zoom meeting/screening. Was scheduled for 30 min, but it seemed to be going very well and we spoke for an hour. Next steps would be a panel zoom meeting, then an on-campus final interview. Pretty standard first round questions and review of the position. Despite my follow-up with a thank you message, no communication has been received back, not even a polite rejection letter. Just ghosted.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Are you willing to work in-person? Strengths? What are your salary requirements?

title: CES Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Elmhurst University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was very demanding and time consuming. Was required to meet with various departments and leadership, went through multiple rounds of interviews with additional people. Lunch was provided.
Interview Questions: Where do you get your inspiration from.

title: Groundskeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Elmhurst University
Interview Descriptions: It was a two step interview process meeting with the person that I would directly report to and a second interview with that person and his supervisor.  It was a similar to most other interviews.
Interview Questions: My background experience regarding tree care and turf care.

title: Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: The search committee reached out three days in advance to ask for an interview. Interview had 5 questions and questions were very easy.   Interview was held over Zoom and lasted right at thirty minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background and how that makes you a good fit for this role.

title: Data Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (Elmhurst, IL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: General interview questions, previous job position inquiries, how one gained technical skills, degree type, and analytical questions. They asked personal questions as to what one likes to do during their spare time, and class schedule. They're very flexible.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with data before?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (Elmhurst, IL) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview with hiring manager, then an in-person interviewed with a VP, a director, the hiring manager again and two other members within the department.   The interview questions were behavioral based.
Interview Questions: What new ideas do you have that you could bring to the team?  What is your management style?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (Elmhurst, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: In depth all day interview, I met with Dean, Students, Department and Non-Dept. Faculty.  The whole process took the entire day, including a presentation with faculty and students. Also included a phone interview before.
Interview Questions: What do you want to contribute to the College

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Elmhurst University
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about two months. Two interviews:  One for the athletic department/coaches, one for the academic program.  The application process is the most strenuous part.  I was offered the position during my 2nd interview (the academic one).
Interview Questions: How do you plan to balance the sports and the academics?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. First interview by phone with immediate supervisor and in-person interview with department head. Final step was a meeting with several other employees in the department. This lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Asked about my interest in and ability to keep accurate records

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Elmhurst University (Elmhurst, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
I was abroad and I could take the interview by Skype.
She was friendly and I felt comfortable.
They are really interested in your educational background, not so much in your professional experience.
Interview Questions: Nothing strange, they are interested in your studies mainly.
